commit_message:
Adds a README

Change-Id: I14a58968fc24dcfdf194b46ed90a1489d34fb089
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/operations-guide refs/changes/89/61889/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This repository contains the source files for the OpenStack Operations Guide. You can read this guide at `docs.openstack.org/ops <http://docs.openstack.org/ops>`_. It was originally authored during a book sprint in February 2013. Read more about Book Sprints at http://www.booksprints.net. Additionally, a tools directory contains tools for testing this guide. Prerequisites ============= `Apache Maven <http://maven.apache.org/>`_ must be installed to build the documentation. To install Maven 3 for Ubuntu 12.04 and later,and Debian wheezy and later:: apt-get install maven On Fedora 15 and later:: yum install maven3 Contributing ============ This book is undergoing a custom edit with O'Reilly publishing and we welcome contributions to make it as accurate as possible. Our target is the Havana release. Our community welcomes all people interested in open source cloud computing, and encourages you to join the `OpenStack Foundation <http://www.openstack.org/join>`_. The best way to get involved with the community is to talk with others online or at a meetup and offer contributions through our processes, the `OpenStack wiki <http://wiki.openstack.org>`_, blogs, or on IRC at ``#openstack`` on ``irc.freenode.net``. Installing OpenStack ==================== Refer to http://docs.openstack.org to see where these documents are published and to learn more about the OpenStack project.

commit_message:
Add driver interfaces validation

This patch will expose a /nodes/<uuid>/validate subresource where users
could GET to trigger a validation on the 'core' and 'standardized'
interfaces for the driver the node loaded with. This will expose a way
to the ironic driver in nova to validate the driver interfaces of a node
before deploying it.

Change-Id: I1ca2b17c9752e7593214fe5b044595f6e63bed18
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/93/54593/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def validate_driver_interfaces(self, context, node_obj): """Validate the `core` and `standardized` interfaces for drivers. :param context: request context. :param node_obj: an RPC style node obj. :returns: a dictonary containing the results of each interface validation. """ return self.call(context, self.make_msg('validate_driver_interfaces', node_obj=node_obj))

commit_message:
Install Guide: Fix OS_AUTH_URL

Fix two places that used 127.0.0.1 as hostname instead of
controller as in the rest of the guide.

Change-Id: Ibc2bbb580c7b5c00bbed4dfa8071ca4596222d6b
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit 5afb31f0c49f62c692cd1282cc48d97412fd9b50)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/28/61928/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export OS_AUTH_URL=http://<replaceable>controller</replaceable>:5000/v2.0/</programlisting>

Change-Id: I71041be832206e52bfb73926199f2c89e0e84a0b
Closes-Bug: #1260423
"}]
commit_message:
Gracefully handle Users with no email attribute

In certain environments, such as when using Keystone with a LDAP
backend, it's possible that the email attribute won't exist for all
users.

Change-Id: I71041be832206e52bfb73926199f2c89e0e84a0b
Closes-Bug: #1260423
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/37/61837/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _update(self, user): email = getattr(user, 'email', '') email=email, 'email': email, def test_update(self): user = self.users.get(id="1") self._update(user) def test_update_with_no_email_attribute(self): user = self.users.get(id="1") del user.email self._update(user)
deleted_lines: def test_update(self): user = self.users.get(id="1") email=u'test@example.com', 'email': user.email,

'}]
commit_message:
Remove LANG=C from rootwrap invocations

For more than a decade already, systems support LC_ALL=C,
which overwrites LANG=C, so setting both is only confusing.

Change-Id: I5640b9cb747892162a856315ea7331cfea7cba5a

commit_message:
Launch integration tests with testr

A new paramter introduced to separate unit and inegration test launch.
Since nosetests is not used anymore, it was removed from requirements.

Readme for integration tests updated.

Change-Id: I6415e2885cae8571c0adb75216d9b11c7372462a
Fixes: bug #1259927

commit_message:
Removing vim lines

Reason:
 - python modules should be free from vim strings,
   those strings are not part of licence headers.
Changes:
 - updating all headers with header single template example

Change-Id: I675bffe015dec646dbba204c435e23fc1ecd95df
Implements: blueprint headers-clean-up

Commands to create the flavor with download limited to 1 MB/sec and create a
virtual machine with this flavor:
---
nova flavor-create --ephemeral=1 victor_test_vif 50 256 1 1

bandwidth is limited to 1 MB/sec (replace 10.0.0.3 with the IP of the virtual

ip netns

dd if=/dev/urandom of=random10MB bs=1024 count=10240
scp random10M cirros@10.0.3:
---

Closes-Bug: #1254664

commit_message:
Fix LibvirtGenericVIFDriver.get_config() for quota

When Nova is used with Neutron and Open vSwitch, network quotas on the
bandwidth are ignored by libvirt: the "<bandwidth>" tag is not generated in
libvirt.xml of the virtual machine. This change fixes this issue but also for
the network types: "bridge", "network" and "direct".

Commands to create the flavor with download limited to 1 MB/sec and create a
virtual machine with this flavor:
---
nova flavor-create --ephemeral=1 victor_test_vif 50 256 1 1
nova flavor-key victor_test_vif set quota:vif_inbound_average=1000
nova boot --flavor=victor_test_vif --image=cirros-0.3.1-x86_64-uec victor_test
---

Commands to upload a file to this virtual machine with SCP to check that the
bandwidth is limited to 1 MB/sec (replace 10.0.0.3 with the IP of the virtual
machine):
---
ip netns
sudo ip netns exec qrouter-128db593-a0db-40c3-84c7-e6383d40c75f bash

dd if=/dev/urandom of=random10MB bs=1024 count=10240
scp random10M cirros@10.0.3:
---

Change-Id: I0f0111fc79fe90900e38df022034b208f1129088
Closes-Bug: #1254664
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/90/58290/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'quota:vif_inbound_peak': '200', 'quota:vif_outbound_peak': '20', 'quota:vif_inbound_average': '100', 'quota:vif_outbound_average': '10', 'quota:vif_inbound_burst': '300', 'quota:vif_outbound_burst': '30' for vif_obj in ( self.vif_bridge, self.vif_ovs, self.vif_ivs, self.vif_8021qbh, self.vif_8021qbg, self.vif_mlnx, self.vif_midonet ): self.flags(libvirt_use_virtio_for_bridges=True) self.flags(virt_type='qemu', group='libvirt') d = vif.LibvirtGenericVIFDriver(self._get_conn()) xml = self._get_instance_xml(d, vif_obj) doc = etree.fromstring(xml) bandwidth = doc.find('./devices/interface/bandwidth') self.assertNotEqual(bandwidth, None) inbound = bandwidth.find('inbound') self.assertEqual(inbound.get("average"), "100") self.assertEqual(inbound.get("peak"), "200") self.assertEqual(inbound.get("burst"), "300") outbound = bandwidth.find('outbound') self.assertEqual(outbound.get("average"), "10") self.assertEqual(outbound.get("peak"), "20") self.assertEqual(outbound.get("burst"), "30") self._assertModel(xml, "virtio", "qemu")
deleted_lines: 'quota:vif_inbound_peak': '102400', 'quota:vif_outbound_peak': '102400', 'quota:vif_inbound_average': '102400', 'quota:vif_outbound_average': '102400', 'quota:vif_inbound_burst': '102400', 'quota:vif_inbound_burst': '102400' self.flags(libvirt_use_virtio_for_bridges=True) self.flags(virt_type='qemu', group='libvirt') d = vif.LibvirtGenericVIFDriver(self._get_conn()) xml = self._get_instance_xml(d, self.vif_bridge) doc = etree.fromstring(xml) ret = doc.findall('./devices/interface/bandwidth') self.assertEqual(len(ret), 1) self._assertModel(xml, "virtio", "qemu")

subject: Have tox install via setup.py develop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-11 17:09:53.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient/commit/07865c914a3f1aa6674de0aef5c4b0b52a06fb27', 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/03/61503/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: minversion = 1.6 skipsdist = Trueusedevelop = True install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
Adds Cinder client mock to tests

Test cases now have a mock for the method tenant_absolute_limits
in cinder client. The absence of this mock was causing real HTTP
requests from this client.

Change-Id: I8b9c4f5affc43e2649f3ebf08580bb3d3687e09b
Closes-Bug: #1259533

commit_message:
Acknowledge Nova VERIFY_RESIZE as RESIZE state

After a resize, Nova changes instances to the VERIFY_RESIZE state,
which must be confirmed before they return to ACTIVE. However, as
far as Trove is concerned instances in VERIFY_RESIZE should still
report RESIZE until they're actually done. Additionally, instance
status unit tests are added to verify that the correct statuses
are reported.

Change-Id: I9c1824f8fe420025f329209c41c7aac1d8d7921c
Closes-Bug: #1217985
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/46/60346/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # As far as Trove is concerned, Nova instances in VERIFY_RESIZE should # still appear as though they are in RESIZE. if self.db_info.server_status in ["VERIFY_RESIZE"]: return "RESIZE"

commit_message:
Return relative URIs for href-template of homedoc

Based on current implement, some href-template of homedoc
are returning absolute path ('/queues'...). It may cause
a 404 error because client may join a host with the path
directly. This patch will make sure all the href-template
start with /v1 and add unit test case to make url joining
works well.

Fixes bug 1245656

Change-Id: I12059249135cdb82be7d1937cf65db5da860011b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/95/61495/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Tox fails to build environment because of MySQL-Python version

  During tox building environment, it try to install the package
MySQL-python version 1.2.4 but the build failed with the error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 16, in <module>
  File "/opt/stack/nova/.tox/py27/build/MySQL-python/setup.py", line 18, in <module>
    metadata, options = get_config()
  File "setup_posix.py", line 43, in get_config
    libs = mysql_config("libs_r")
  File "setup_posix.py", line 25, in mysql_config
    raise EnvironmentError("%s not found" % (mysql_config.path,))
EnvironmentError: mysql_config not found

This patch fix the version at 1.2.3
The nova review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61955/

Change-Id: Id9e0afacee40adf101d40d076e1f5443b56523d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/27/62027/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MySQL-python==1.2.3

commit_message:
Fix periodic tasks running over engine

 * Fix unit tests
 * Fix event model
 * Fix using engine module
 * Added sending signal to run workflow in events
 * Creating events when WB definition is uploaded

Change-Id: Ica7a5c0d0c367f3c7396ed1650753f1570f797b7

commit_message:
Ensure object model is loaded at correct time

Move common service startup code to solum/common/service for use
in other commands.  Object model is then loaded after configuration
is parsed so that subclasses can choose behavior based on the config,
for instance, whether the new or old schema is in place.

Change-Id: Icb692e40eaa65b545eae916bdd6c84396ea0e625
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/11/58111/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add sqlalchemy subclass for Application

Add an implementation package for the base object API that reuses
sqlalchemy ORM for model definition, but which provides its own
object level methods for persistence (create, save, and delete).
Most object-impls can then share common code, with a few callouts
explicitly intended to support live schema migration.

The default backend object implementation for Solum is
solum/objects/sqalchemy.

Change-Id: Icbf53ff07097e4c74c4fef155cc0bf5bc54efc18

added_lines: # Copyright 2013 - Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """ SQLAlchemy models for application data. """ import urlparse from oslo.config import cfg from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import declarative_base from solum import objects from solum.openstack.common.db import exception as db_exc from solum.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy import models from solum.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy import session as db_session sql_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('mysql_engine', default='InnoDB', help='MySQL engine'), ] cfg.CONF.register_opts(sql_opts, 'database') def table_args(): engine_name = urlparse.urlparse(cfg.CONF.database_connection).scheme if engine_name == 'mysql': return {'mysql_engine': cfg.CONF.mysql_engine, 'mysql_charset': "utf8"} return None def model_query(context, model, *args, **kwargs): """Query helper. :param context: context to query under :param session: if present, the session to use """ session = kwargs.get('session') or db_session.get_session() query = session.query(model, *args) return query class SolumBase(models.TimestampMixin, models.ModelBase): metadata = None @classmethod def obj_name(cls): return cls.__name__ def as_dict(self): d = {} for c in self.__table__.columns: d[c.name] = self[c.name] return d @classmethod def get_by_id(cls, context, item_id): query = db_session.get_session().query(cls).filter_by(id=item_id) result = query.first() if not result: cls._not_found(item_id) return result def save(self, context): if objects.transition_schema(): self.add_forward_schema_changes() session = db_session.get_session() with session.begin(): session.merge(self) # updates = self.obj_get_changes() # updates.pop('id', None) # session = db_session.get_session() # with session.begin(): # query = session.query(self.__class__).filter_by(id=self.id) # result = query.first() # if not result: # self._not_found(self.id) # result.update(updates) # self.obj_reset_changes() def create(self, context): session = db_session.get_session() with session.begin(): try: session.add(self) except db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry as e: self.__class__._duplicate_object(e, self) #self.obj_reset_changes() def destroy(self, context): session = db_session.get_session() with session.begin(): session.query(self.__class__).\ filter_by(id=self.id).\ delete() Base = declarative_base(cls=SolumBase)

commit_message:
Add mpcut.sh for milestone-proposed branch cutting

Add an mpcut.sh script (similar to the mpdelivery.sh script) which
handles all steps required at milestone-proposed branch cutting
time in the release process:

- Creating milestone-proposed branch in gerrit
- Wait for tarball creation (calls wait_for_tarball.py)
- Set all FixCommitted bugs to FixReleased (calls process_bugs.py)

Change-Id: I417ad6247501afd7c18fdc989ae7b561c2c32814
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/89/61389/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Script to cut milestone-proposed branches in one shot # # Copyright 2011-2013 Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org> # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. set -e if [ $# -lt 3 ]; then echo "Usage: $0 SHA milestone projectname" echo echo "Example: $0 HEAD havana-1 keystone" exit 2 fi SHA=$1 MILESTONE=$2 PROJECT=$3 TOOLSDIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )" function title { echo echo "$(tput bold)$(tput setaf 1)[ $1 ]$(tput sgr0)" } title "Cloning repository for $PROJECT" MYTMPDIR=`mktemp -d` cd $MYTMPDIR git clone git://git.openstack.org/openstack/$PROJECT cd $PROJECT git review -s if git show-ref --verify --quiet refs/heads/milestone-proposed; then echo "milestone-proposed branch already exists !" cd ../.. rm -rf $MYTMPDIR exit 1 fi title "Creating milestone-proposed at $SHA" git branch milestone-proposed $SHA REALSHA=`git show-ref -s milestone-proposed` git push gerrit milestone-proposed title "Cleaning up repository" cd ../.. rm -rf $MYTMPDIR title "Waiting for tarball from $REALSHA" $TOOLSDIR/wait_for_tarball.py $REALSHA title "Setting FixCommitted bugs to FixReleased" $TOOLSDIR/process_bugs.py $PROJECT --settarget=$MILESTONE --fixrelease

commit_message:
Revert "Add a Trait Type model and db table"

This reverts commit d80f30f56803acaf2fac2569af8e99d70c1d2b48.

This commit introduces a new migration script that fails to pass the
tests on MySQL (at least). This patch simply reverts it altogether until
it's fixed.

Change-Id: Ia119f7a55637b3c13bbc28493579458c482e8693
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/73/59973/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class UniqueName(Base): """Key names should only be stored once. """ __tablename__ = 'unique_name' __table_args__ = ( Index('ix_unique_name_key', 'key'), ) id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True) key = Column(String(255)) def __init__(self, key): self.key = key def __repr__(self): return "<UniqueName: %s>" % self.key Index('ix_trait_t_type', 't_type'), name_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('unique_name.id')) name = relationship("UniqueName", backref=backref('name', order_by=id)) t_type = Column(Integer) def __init__(self, name, event, t_type, t_string=None, t_float=None, t_int=None, t_datetime=None): self.name = name self.t_type = t_type if self.t_type == api_models.Trait.INT_TYPE: if self.t_type == api_models.Trait.FLOAT_TYPE: if self.t_type == api_models.Trait.DATETIME_TYPE: if self.t_type == api_models.Trait.TEXT_TYPE: return "<Trait(%s) %d=%s/%s/%s/%s on %s>" % (self.name, self.t_type, self.t_string, self.t_float, self.t_int, self.t_datetime, self.event)
deleted_lines: class TraitType(Base): """Types of event traits. A trait type includes a description and a data type. Uniqueness is enforced compositely on the data_type and desc fields. This is to accommodate cases, such as 'generated', which, depending on the corresponding event, could be a date, a boolean, or a float. """ __tablename__ = 'trait_type' __table_args__ = ( UniqueConstraint('desc', 'data_type', name='tt_unique'), Index('ix_trait_type', 'desc') ) id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True) desc = Column(String(255)) data_type = Column(Integer) def __init__(self, desc, data_type): self.desc = desc self.data_type = data_type def __repr__(self): return "<TraitType: %s:%d>" % (self.desc, self.data_type) trait_type_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('trait_type.id')) trait_type = relationship("TraitType", backref=backref('trait_type')) def __init__(self, trait_type, event, t_string=None, t_float=None, t_int=None, t_datetime=None): self.trait_type = trait_type if self.trait_type is None: dtype = None else: dtype = self.trait_type.data_type if dtype == api_models.Trait.INT_TYPE: if dtype == api_models.Trait.FLOAT_TYPE: if dtype == api_models.Trait.DATETIME_TYPE: if dtype == api_models.Trait.TEXT_TYPE: name = self.trait_type.name if self.trait_type else None data_type = self.trait_type.data_type if self.trait_type\ else api_models.Trait.NONE_TYPE return "<Trait(%s) %d=%s/%s/%s/%s on %s>" % (name, data_type, self.t_string, self.t_float, self.t_int, self.t_datetime, self.event)

commit_message:
glance-manage should work like nova-manage

nova-manage supports subcommands of db, for nova-manage,
eg) 'nova-manage db sync',
glance manage however has individual commands like db_sync, db_version
etc. This patch aims at adding the db operations as subcommands to db in
glance-manage similar to nova and refactoring this bit of code in
cmd/manage.py

Fixes: bug 1213197
Change-Id: I6fad31766bc1cec2a666a7ebc8df5c732007c5f1

added_lines: from glance.db.sqlalchemy import migrationclass DbCommands(object): """Class for managing the db""" def __init__(self): pass def version(self): print migration.db_version() def upgrade(self, version=None): version = version or CONF.command.version migration.upgrade(version) def downgrade(self, version=None): version = version or CONF.command.version migration.downgrade(version) def version_control(self, version=None): version = version or CONF.command.version migration.version_control(version) def sync(self, version=None, current_version=None): version = version or CONF.command.version current_version = current_version or CONF.command.current_version migration.db_sync(version, current_version) command_object = DbCommands() parser = subparsers.add_parser('db') parser.set_defaults(command_object=command_object) category_subparsers = parser.add_subparsers(dest='action') for (action, action_fn) in methods_of(command_object): parser = category_subparsers.add_parser(action) for args in getattr(action_fn, 'args', []): parser.add_argument(*args) parser.set_defaults(action_fn=action_fn) def methods_of(obj): """Get all callable methods of an object that don't start with underscore returns a list of tuples of the form (method_name, method) """ result = [] for i in dir(obj): if callable(getattr(obj, i)) and not i.startswith('_'): result.append((i, getattr(obj, i))) return result CONF.command.action_fn()

commit_message:
Wait for nova-compute to claim to be up

Even with wait conditions, it is hard to judge from inside the
nova-compute host that nova-compute has decided it is "up".

We can poll nova service-list to know that for sure however.

Change-Id: Ibad0faa24e7d551ef5e78a2e9c1bb8f7d31fa9d1
Closes-Bug: #1260543

commit_message:
keystoneclient scenario test

We'd like to move the keystoneclient tests from Keystone to
Tempest. This is an initial copy of one of the keystoneclient
tests from keystone to a tempest scenario. Eventually, all of
Keystone's keystoneclient tests will be here.

bp keystoneclient-api

Change-Id: I6d32dda4a63376ef28457f7cba01324e59824bca

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.scenario import manager DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID = 'default' class DefaultFixtures(object): USERS = [ { 'id': 'foo', 'name': 'FOO', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'password': 'foo2', 'tenants': ['bar'], 'enabled': True, 'email': 'foo@bar.com', }, { 'id': 'two', 'name': 'TWO', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'password': 'two2', 'email': 'two@example.com', 'enabled': True, 'default_project_id': 'baz', 'tenants': ['baz'], 'email': 'two@three.com', }, { 'id': 'badguy', 'name': 'BadGuy', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'password': 'bad', 'email': 'bad@guy.com', 'enabled': False, 'default_project_id': 'baz', 'tenants': ['baz'], 'email': 'badguy@goodguy.com', }, { 'id': 'sna', 'name': 'SNA', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'password': 'snafu', 'enabled': True, 'tenants': ['bar'], 'email': 'sna@snl.coom', } ] default_fixtures = DefaultFixtures() class CompatTestCase(manager.OfficialClientTest): def setUp(self): super(CompatTestCase, self).setUp() self.load_fixtures(default_fixtures) def load_fixtures(self, fixtures): admin_user = 'admin' admin_password = 'ofs5dac' admin_project_name = 'demo' client = self._client(admin=True, username=admin_user, password=admin_password, tenant_name=admin_project_name) project_name = 'BAR' tenant = client.tenants.create(project_name, description='description', enabled=True) self.tenant_bar = { 'id': tenant.id, 'name': 'BAR', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'description': 'description', 'enabled': True, } tenant_id = tenant.id name = 'foo' password = 'foo2' user_foo = client.users.create(name, password, email='foo@bar.com', tenant_id=tenant_id, enabled=True) self.user_foo = { 'id': user_foo.id, 'name': 'FOO', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'password': 'foo2', 'tenants': [tenant_id], 'enabled': True, 'email': 'foo@bar.com', } def _admin_url(self): public_port = 35357 # FIXME: Is there a config for this? return "http://localhost:%s/v2.0" % public_port def _public_url(self): public_port = 5000 # FIXME: Is there a config for this? return "http://localhost:%s/v2.0" % public_port def _client(self, admin=False, **kwargs): from keystoneclient.v2_0 import client as ks_client url = self._admin_url() if admin else self._public_url() kc = ks_client.Client(endpoint=url, auth_url=self._public_url(), **kwargs) kc.authenticate() # have to manually overwrite the management url after authentication kc.management_url = url return kc def get_client(self, user_ref=None, tenant_ref=None, admin=False): if user_ref is None: user_ref = self.user_foo if tenant_ref is None: tenant_id = user_ref['tenants'][0] else: tenant_id = tenant_ref['id'] return self._client(username=user_ref['name'], password=user_ref['password'], tenant_id=tenant_id, admin=admin) class KeystoneClientTests(object): def test_authenticate_tenant_name_and_tenants(self): client = self.get_client() tenants = client.tenants.list() self.assertEqual(tenants[0].id, self.tenant_bar['id']) class Kc11TestCase(CompatTestCase, KeystoneClientTests): pass

commit_message:
Remove sqlalchemy-migrate 0.7.3 patching

Now that sqlalchemy-migrate 0.8.x is available, remove the 0.7.3
patching. This allows environments to pick up 0.8.1 automatically,
while avoiding the version string error. Once an update to
global-requirements is made, another patch will pin our
sqlalchemy-migrate version >= 0.8.2.

This is copied from change I646a5a8f427095e20b09fbf2db796d2644def6fc

Closes-bug: 1251700
Change-Id: I51178d5b4dff56b92d2de08a73924bba56e975b6

commit_message:
Use six.moves.configparser instead of ConfigParser

The ConfigParser module has been renamed to configparser in Python 3.
See http://docs.python.org/2/library/configparser.html

Implements: blueprint make-python3-compatible
Change-Id: I13cfd5e90f1b5d342b2f3ef6dd0d246c4fda6156

commit_message:
Sync iso8601 requirement and fixes test case failures

1. Sync requirements from global Iece0116d3c412216251e2d7fbffe10bfe2c1c789
2. iso8601>=0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle date string
which only have date part like YYYY-MM-DD, it caused two Glance test
cases failure.

Fixes bug: 1242501

Grizzly notice: this should fix stable/grizzly tempest failure
 error: Installed distribution iso8601 0.1.4 conflicts with requirement iso8601>=0.1.8
 at the expense of bumping version requirement for iso8601 on stable branch!

Also incldues: Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

Fixes bug: 1259511

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-
fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I2625eb3888111829a9da4d093b34193b8795f264
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8160ae293383ec600c05fd2e4b38164bca7704c4)
Conflicts:
        glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py
        glance/tests/unit/v1/test_registry_api.py
        tools/pip-requires

commit_message:
This is the initial commit of the savanna puppet module.

Installs the OpenStack savanna UI and backend. Example of
use can be seen in example/example.pp

Change-Id: I3b994f70690078d37a42308f9985712e2f398924
Implements: blueprint puppet-savanna

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # Used to setup the savanna keystone user # class savanna::keystone::auth ( $password = 'savanna', $auth_name = 'savanna', $email = 'savanna@localhost', $tenant = 'services', $configure_endpoint = true, $service_type = 'mapreduce', $public_address = '127.0.0.1', $admin_address = '127.0.0.1', $internal_address = '127.0.0.1', $port = '8386', $public_port = undef, $region = 'RegionOne', $public_protocol = 'http', $internal_protocol = 'http', ) { Keystone_user_role["${auth_name}@${tenant}"] ~> Service <| name == 'savanna-api' |> if !$public_port { $real_public_port = $port } else { $real_public_port = $public_port } keystone_user { $auth_name: ensure => present, password => $password, email => $email, tenant => $tenant, } keystone_user_role { "${auth_name}@${tenant}": ensure => present, roles => 'admin', } keystone_service { $auth_name: ensure => present, type => $service_type, description => 'Savanna MapReduce Service', } if $configure_endpoint { keystone_endpoint { "${region}/${auth_name}": ensure => present, public_url => "${public_protocol}://${public_address}:${real_public_port}/", internal_url => "${internal_protocol}://${internal_address}:${port}/", admin_url => "${internal_protocol}://${admin_address}:${port}/", } } }

commit_message:
DB migration 209: Clean up child rows as well

Fixes bug 1252891

In order to add missing foreign key constraints, rows that reference a
nonexistant key need to be purged. Unfortunately, DB migration 209 does
not clean up any rows in child tables that themselves have a foreign key
constraint on the tables with the missing foreign keys. This can result
in an integrity violation causing the migration to fail.

When purging the rows, make sure to purge rows in any child tables first.

Change-Id: I25bd899383c72cb0670819b030759630ac89acaa

commit_message:
Add ceph::repo RedHat support

Adds repo's required to support RedHat distros.
Update case tests so RedHat doesn't fail.

Sourced from: https://github.com/Mirantis/fuel/blob/master/deployment/puppet/ceph/manifests/yum.pp

System spec tests will be provided in a follow up commit
repos are from a working deployment and are tested by hand.

Closes-bug: #1243872
Change-Id: I6d9e356bac6855fd30c522916bf7c4867195488c

commit_message:
Use ensure_packages with dnsmasq package resource

Use ensure_packages with the dnsmasq package resource to allow
coexistance with other modules which define the same resource
name (puppet-cobbler, for example).

Cherry-pick from review.openstack.org/#/c/61737/

Change-Id: I4fb081f822596f2f025f952525d5333c5a5b1364

commit_message:
Remove obsolete options for qpid reconnect.

Qpid reconnect options were removed from oslo.
Russel Bryant removed these from Nova on commit
b2facb4f4ff2ee75366ec9e51dd59eede5bbb47d

Change-Id: I372c9358d9ae2628e3403fb817823aa4e38dea76
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/33/61933/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: it { should contain_nova_config('DEFAULT/qpid_reconnect').with_value(true) } it { should contain_nova_config('DEFAULT/qpid_reconnect_timeout').with_value('0') } it { should contain_nova_config('DEFAULT/qpid_reconnect_limit').with_value('0') } it { should contain_nova_config('DEFAULT/qpid_reconnect_interval_min').with_value('0') } it { should contain_nova_config('DEFAULT/qpid_reconnect_interval_max').with_value('0') } it { should contain_nova_config('DEFAULT/qpid_reconnect_interval').with_value('0') }

commit_message:
Add IPAddress field type

This will allow either a v4 or v6 IP address.

Introduce 'ip' synonym for 'netaddr.IPAddress' to tests, for
readability.

This is part of: blueprint make-resource-tracker-use-objects

Change-Id: I6a7c8f0924f524d1dbf8071bb553c2e9be912894
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/61967/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class IPAddress(FieldType): @staticmethod def coerce(obj, attr, value): try: return netaddr.IPAddress(value) except netaddr.AddrFormatError as e: raise ValueError(str(e)) def from_primitive(self, obj, attr, value): return self.coerce(obj, attr, value) @staticmethod def to_primitive(obj, attr, value): return str(value) class IPAddressField(AutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE = IPAddress()

commit_message:
Use ensure_packages with dnsmasq package resource

Use ensure_packages with the dnsmasq package resource to allow
coexistance with other modules which define the same resource
name (puppet-cobbler, for example).

Cherry-pick from review.openstack.org/#/c/61737/

Change-Id: I00b85f7838a737e2040a73989f5d5771f48918a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/04/62004/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Package[$::neutron::params::dnsmasq_packages] -> Package<| title == 'neutron-dhcp-agent' |> ensure_packages($::neutron::params::dnsmasq_packages)
deleted_lines: Package['dnsmasq'] -> Package<| title == 'neutron-dhcp-agent' |> ensure_resource('package', 'dnsmasq', { ensure => present, name => $::neutron::params::dnsmasq_packages, })

Change-Id: I6dace6a34b79170a88aa571141bb3cb52ba08027

commit_message:
Fix check for overcloud compute hostname

The overcloud compute hostname is actually overcloud-novacompute0-xxxxx,
so the extra dash here was failing the check.  This should hopefully
resolve the latest CD cloud failure.

Change-Id: I6dace6a34b79170a88aa571141bb3cb52ba08027
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/99/61999/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: wait_for 30 10 neutron agent-list -f csv -c alive -c agent_type -c host \| grep '":-).*Open vSwitch agent.*overcloud-novacompute"'
deleted_lines: wait_for 30 10 neutron agent-list -f csv -c alive -c agent_type -c host \| grep '":-).*Open vSwitch agent.*overcloud-novacompute-"'

commit_message:
Log exception in _heal_instance_info_cache

Previously, if errors occurred in _heal_instance_info_cache() they would
go unnoticed as their log level was debug and the stace trace was not
displayed. This patch changes that so the exception is logged so periodic
failures here can be more easily detected and fixed.

Change-Id: I15bb3e7e29462e930f6159be9f4bbf4980b1270c
Closes-bug: #1257940
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/98/60098/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.exception(_("An error occurred:"))

subject: Lazy log the fixed_key warnings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-10 20:00:56.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/keymgr/conf_key_mgr.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3badd1ffbe8796d27b924f882ed05b8d3f4f0f11', 'message': 'Lazy log the fixed_key warnings

Cinder currently spews quite a bit of WARNINGs like this with
the default settings:

WARNING cinder.keymgr.conf_key_mgr [-] config option keymgr.fixed_key
has not been defined: some operations may fail unexpectedly

Many users may not be using features that require key manager...
so logging the WARNING message a bit more lazily seems reasonable.

Change-Id: I5ab72285c7d4bc2ec3196dd94fabf977b3a4ebaf
Closes-bug: 1252512
'}]
commit_message:
Lazy log the fixed_key warnings

Cinder currently spews quite a bit of WARNINGs like this with
the default settings:

WARNING cinder.keymgr.conf_key_mgr [-] config option keymgr.fixed_key
has not been defined: some operations may fail unexpectedly

Many users may not be using features that require key manager...
so logging the WARNING message a bit more lazily seems reasonable.

Change-Id: I5ab72285c7d4bc2ec3196dd94fabf977b3a4ebaf
Closes-bug: 1252512
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/06/61206/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.warn(_('config option keymgr.fixed_key has not been defined: ' 'some operations may fail unexpectedly'))
deleted_lines: if CONF.keymgr.fixed_key is None: LOG.warn(_('config option keymgr.fixed_key has not been defined: ' 'some operations may fail unexpectedly'))

commit_message:
Use ensure_packages with dnsmasq package resource

Use ensure_packages with the dnsmasq package resource to allow
coexistance with other modules which define the same resource
name (puppet-cobbler, for example).

Change-Id: Id4cb8b4fdf291f3a62682ab5655ac4eaf2a5370b

commit_message:
Provisioning via Heat

A work in progress change. Seems like basic provisioning, scaling,
adding floating IPs, cinder volumes, rollback works.

Heat Template for Hadoop cluster now looks as is follows:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/54693/

TODOs which will be done in separate CRs:
 * Extract common part of instances.py and instances_heat.py
   https://bugs.launchpad.net/savanna/+bug/1259170
 * Add Anti-Affinity feature to Heat engine
   https://bugs.launchpad.net/savanna/+bug/1259172
 * Add Nova Network support
   https://bugs.launchpad.net/savanna/+bug/1259176
 * Add more unit tests to heat engine
   https://bugs.launchpad.net/savanna/+bug/1259174
 * Make sure CI works with the Heat engine turned on
   (Not CR for that, will be done manually soon)

Co-Authored-By: Alexander Ignatov <aignatov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I679ad4afa9f27c3c9ea69ac046a5629a11d6e190
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/78/55978/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heatclient import exc as heat_excfrom savanna.utils.openstack import heat target_count = {} for node_group in cluster.node_groups: target_count[node_group.id] = node_group.count conductor.node_group_update(ctx, node_group, {"count": 0}) _provision(ctx, cluster, target_count)def scale_cluster(cluster, target_count): instance_ids = _provision(ctx, cluster, target_count, scale=True) conductor.cluster_update(ctx, cluster, {"status": "Active"}) cluster = conductor.cluster_get(ctx, cluster) clean_cluster_from_empty_ng(cluster) def _provision(ctx, cluster, target_count, scale=False): # create all instances conductor.cluster_update(ctx, cluster, {"status": "Spawning"}) LOG.info(g.format_cluster_status(cluster)) tmpl = heat.ClusterTemplate(cluster.name, cluster.neutron_management_network, cluster.user_keypair_id) _configure_template(ctx, tmpl, cluster, target_count) stack = tmpl.instantiate(update_existing=scale) stack.wait_till_active() inst_ids = _populate_cluster(ctx, cluster, stack) # wait for all instances are up and networks ready cluster = conductor.cluster_update(ctx, cluster, {"status": "Waiting"}) LOG.info(g.format_cluster_status(cluster)) instances = get_instances(cluster, inst_ids) _await_networks(cluster, instances) # revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-13 12:32:03.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/53a0b477597bb1937e87c1537e49cbbf87ac88ca', 'message': 'Fix wait for Neutron L2 Agent

A recent commit adds a wait for the Neutron L2 agent to be ready before
continuing with devtest. wait_for seem to have trouble with the way the
quotes are escaped. This commit changes them to wildcards instead.

The check was also waiting for the agent on the notcompute node,
according to the commit message the compute node was what was

Change-Id: I231cde6263dd193767989f65b87162cf96a2803c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix wait for Neutron L2 Agent

A recent commit adds a wait for the Neutron L2 agent to be ready before
continuing with devtest. wait_for seem to have trouble with the way the
quotes are escaped. This commit changes them to wildcards instead.

The check was also waiting for the agent on the notcompute node,
according to the commit message the compute node was what was
intended(which makes more sense), this commit also changes the
check to wait for the agent on compute.

Change-Id: I231cde6263dd193767989f65b87162cf96a2803c

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(A in B) to assertIn(A, B)

The code in tests was using assertTrue(A in B) and similar
instead of assertIn / assertNotIn.

assertIn / assertNotIn assertions are provided by `testtools` package,
so this change is not breaking backward compatibility with Python 2.6.

Closes-Bug: #1259295

Change-Id: Ibf3b0c7f27895699db8a13bf6e1640d196f1a953

commit_message:
Quoting attachment filename

Attachment file name was not surrounded by quotes.
If an attachment was "picture of me.png", the browser was proposing to
download a file named "picture".

Change-Id: I17a1f8ca3b7ef44171c4977bacc9045e4695e18c
Closes-bug: #1245927

commit_message:
Update Instance from database after destroy

In cases where Nova falls back to simply locally deleting an
instance, the Instance object was not updated with the deleted_at
generated by the database implementation. Due to this, the
notification emitted to signify that the delete finished was
getting emitted without a deleted_at value.

This change uses the result from the instance_destroy call to
update the Instance object with the latest state from the database.
Thus, the compute.instance.delete.end notification is emitted
with the proper deleted_at value.

Closes-Bug: #1250206
Change-Id: I55ed37cf89dd6eb8ea901c6f813191a0ce1058e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/64/56264/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: db_inst = db.instance_destroy(context, self.uuid, constraint=constraint) self.deleted_at = db_inst['deleted_at'] self.obj_reset_changes(fields=['deleted_at'])

commit_message:
Try decoding string to UTF-8 on error message fail

Database Errors from SQLAlchemy tend to get mangled into ASCII. If an
error is process that contains UTF-8 data in ASCII form if fails to
build the message and will lead to a 5xx error. Catch the error and try
to decode it to create the message again, if that doesn't work at least
fail gracefully.

Closes-Bug: 1253905
Change-Id: I1865b01f57f5c277a70085e9bad5697f5ceafad1
(cherry picked from commit dcefe5874de3073551226c0bdd1e70f00d6a91a1)

added_lines: import six from keystone.openstack.common import strutils try: message = self.message_format % kwargs except UnicodeDecodeError: try: kwargs = dict([(k, strutils.safe_decode(v)) for k, v in six.iteritems(kwargs)]) except UnicodeDecodeError: # NOTE(jamielennox): This is the complete failure case # at least by showing the template we have some idea # of where the error is coming from message = self.message_format else: message = self.message_format % kwargs

commit_message:
Don't create Member role

Creating the "_member_" role and "Member" role creates confusion.
"_member_" has special significance to keystone, so we keep that.

Horizon is modified to use "_member_" as the default role in [1].
This change should be merged after that.

See also rhbz#984294 [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60462/
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=984294

Change-Id: If4ed1c2c72ca67acad7b70651e68ff7ce68157dd

commit_message:
Add support for resource_types

This adds the following commands:
$ heat resource-type-list
$ heat resource-type-show <resource type>

Change-Id: Ifa70da5bc56a5f2979697a9ce2c41fa9a5c1f947
Closes-bug: #1260130
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/24/61624/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def do_resource_type_list(hc, args={}): '''List the available resource types.''' kwargs = {} types = hc.resource_types.list(**kwargs) utils.print_list(types, ['resource_type']) @utils.arg('resource_type', metavar='<RESOURCE_TYPE>', help='Resource Type to get the details for.') def do_resource_type_show(hc, args={}): '''Show the resource type.''' try: resource_type = hc.resource_types.get(args.resource_type) except exc.HTTPNotFound: raise exc.CommandError( 'Resource Type not found: %s' % args.resource_type) else: print(json.dumps(resource_type, indent=2))

Red Hat's QA noticed that in case of the infamous "xattr>=0.4"

commit_message:
Return an exit code for configuration errors

Red Hat's QA noticed that in case of the infamous "xattr>=0.4"
error, swift-init exits with a zero error code, which confuses
startup scripts (not Systemd though -- that one knows exactly
if processes run or not).

The easiest fix is to return the error code like Guido's blog
post suggested.

Change-Id: I7badd8742375a7cb2aa5606277316477b8083f8d
Fixes: rhbz#1020480

commit_message:
Change unstable test which gets console output

We don't necessarily get "REBOOT" status of a server because the
state is ephemeral. As the result, the test fails sometimes.
This patch changes the server status from "REBOOT" to "SHUTOFF" for
stable test condition.

Closes-Bug: #1014683
Change-Id: I4b06b148b5d9bceda0cef2d2bb5f3b72325928ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/16/59116/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix simple-db image filtering on extra properties

This fixes a bug in simple DB that causes filtering of images based on
extra-properties to fail. The current code works only when an image has no
extra-properties or exactly one. The current test suite doesn't include a test
that tries to filter images based on more than one extra-property.

Also, added both functional and unit tests to test image list with filters
using more than one extra-property.

Fixes bug: 1259227
Change-Id: I4c0d294585235dacbf154bf0df5d1e7c4a172cdd

alignment with project standards.

commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

Reasons:
 - tox update v1.6

Changes:
 - tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow.
 - It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
   important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
   weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I0b2da3369ec303b9997305f602e6c444cafe14b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/30/60830/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: minversion = 1.6 skipsdist = Trueusedevelop = True install_command = pip install {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Remove generic_setup_package() function

The generic_setup_package() function was previously run at init which
was causing a dependency on a config when a file was imported. This
commit takes that functionality and puts it in a classmethod and calls
that in setUpClass. There was nothing in generic_setup_package() that
needed to be run during so init, so this moves it to the proper place.

Change-Id: I32fa0fb1e230a98a3a9ca732df2d013ca4f13dce

If the test cases are allowed to create # users (config.compute.allow_tenant_isolation is true, # then we allow multi-user. if not CONFIG.compute.allow_tenant_isolation: user1 = CONFIG.identity.username user2 = CONFIG.identity.alt_username if not user2 or user1 == user2: MULTI_USER = False else: user2_password = CONFIG.identity.alt_password user2_tenant_name = CONFIG.identity.alt_tenant_name if not user2_password or not user2_tenant_name: msg = ("Alternate user specified but not alternate " "tenant or password: alt_tenant_name=%s alt_password=%s" % (user2_tenant_name, user2_password)) raise InvalidConfiguration(msg)

commit_message:
Add some tests to demonstrate hash_cleanup_listdir

We add some tests to verify various behaviors of
hash_cleanup_listdir(), and break them into individual tests so that
one failure won't prevent the others from running as well.

Change-Id: I4f52388d813f061b8e7d2b45dfb0f805689020c2

subject: Add assertSetEqual to base test class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-09 06:25:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/29e1e6769871322f651474f5894d3494f37754bc', 'message': 'Add assertSetEqual to base test class

Implement and add assertSetEqual to the base test class so that the
functionaly of set-specific comparison can be used in python 2.6.
Once python 2.6 support is deprecated completly, this new method
can be deleted and the tests will fall back onto the upstream version
of this test.  This is a copy of the method implemented on the TestCase
super class in python 2.7 with minor changes to conform to OpenStack

commit_message:
Add assertSetEqual to base test class

Implement and add assertSetEqual to the base test class so that the
functionaly of set-specific comparison can be used in python 2.6.
Once python 2.6 support is deprecated completly, this new method
can be deleted and the tests will fall back onto the upstream version
of this test.  This is a copy of the method implemented on the TestCase
super class in python 2.7 with minor changes to conform to OpenStack
Hacking.

bp: dogpile-kvs-backends
Change-Id: I76a7d9a10b30ed6b0ac0aef4e5dd522cafb321e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/49/60749/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def assertSetEqual(self, set1, set2, msg=None): """A set-specific equality assertion. Args: set1: The first set to compare. set2: The second set to compare. msg: Optional message to use on failure instead of a list of differences. assertSetEqual uses ducktyping to support different types of sets, and is optimized for sets specifically (parameters must support a difference method). """ # TODO(morganfainberg): Fallback to the provided version of this once # python 2.6 support is deprecated. This method is implemented as of # python 2.7 on the TestCase super class. try: difference1 = set1.difference(set2) except TypeError as e: self.fail('invalid type when attempting set difference: %s' % e) except AttributeError as e: self.fail('first argument does not support set difference: %s' % e) try: difference2 = set2.difference(set1) except TypeError as e: self.fail('invalid type when attempting set difference: %s' % e) except AttributeError as e: self.fail('second argument does not support set difference: %s' % e) if not (difference1 or difference2): return lines = [] if difference1: lines.append('Items in the first set but not the second:') for item in difference1: lines.append(repr(item)) if difference2: lines.append('Items in the second set but not the first:') for item in difference2: lines.append(repr(item)) standardMsg = '\n'.join(lines) self.fail(self._formatMessage(msg, standardMsg))

commit_message:
Don't replace instance.info_cache on each save

If we are working on an Instance that came from an older client,
we should not replace an older nested .info_cache object with a
newer one for no reason during a save().

Related-Bug: #1258256
Change-Id: I8cf4a629d454de1a5de16ea4032f39e36aab505a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/60323/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: info_cache = None else: info_cache = instance_info_cache.InstanceInfoCache() context, info_cache, db_inst['info_cache']) instance['info_cache'] = info_cache

commit_message:
Remove useless statement which is a performance bottleneck

The statement makes no change to a list of volumes items, but causes
cinder volume list api response reduced 10 times for a user with 1000
volumes.

Change-Id: I8d915d16368a38ff00f2aee54d2a9ff32e45647c

Change-Id: Ib406650ea755425337642c868f5d19989b6cf246
Implements: blueprint add-python-troveclient-tests
'}]
commit_message:
Tempest test for python troveclient

Implements the tests for following commands:
1. Flavor show
2. Instance list
3. Create Instance
4. Delete instance
4. Database create
4. Database list.

Change-Id: Ib406650ea755425337642c868f5d19989b6cf246
Implements: blueprint add-python-troveclient-tests
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/27/61727/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2013 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import datetime from oslo.config import cfg import subprocess import tempest.cli from tempest.openstack.common import log as logging CONF = cfg.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class SimpleReadOnlyTroveClientTest(tempest.cli.ClientTestBase): """ This is a first pass at a simple read only python-troveclient test. This only exercises client commands that are read only. This should test commands: * as a regular user * as a admin user * with and without optional parameters * initially just check return codes, and later test command outputs """ def test_admin_fake_action(self): self.assertRaises(subprocess.CalledProcessError, self.trove, 'this-does-trove-exist') def test_trove_flavor_list(self): out = self.trove('flavor-list') endpoints = self.parser.listing(out) self.assertTableStruct(endpoints, [ 'id', 'name', 'ram']) def test_trove_instance_list(self): out = self.trove('list') endpoints = self.parser.listing(out) self.assertTableStruct(endpoints, [ 'id', 'name', 'status', 'flavor_id', 'size']) def test_trove_flavor_show(self): out = self.trove('flavor-show', params='2') endpoints = self.parser.listing(out) self.assertTableStruct(endpoints, [ 'Property', 'Value']) def test_trove_create_instance(self): self.trove('create', params='--size 2 test 2') def check_machine_status(self): """To check the status of the machine & the retrieve the ID of the machine """ ACTIVE = False timeout = 20 * 60 now1 = datetime.datetime.now() current_time = (now1.hour * 3600 + now1.minute * 60 + now1.second) # Check the machine status if not ACTIVE: now2 = datetime.datetime.now() elapsed_time = (now2.hour * 3600 + now2.minute * 60 + now2.second) out = self.trove('list') endpoints = self.parser.listing(out) # To check if instance list is working self.assertTableStruct(endpoints, [ 'id', 'name', 'status', 'flavor_id', 'size']) elements = out.split() for i in elements: if i == "test": INDEX = elements.index(i) if elements[INDEX + 2] == 'ACTIVE': ACTIVE = True if (elapsed_time - current_time) > timeout: LOG.debug("Machine is not active. Aborting..!!!") break # Get the id of the guest machine if ACTIVE: id3 = elements[INDEX - 2] return id3 break def test_trove_list_database(self): id3 = self.check_machine_status() id3 = str(id3) self.trove('database-list', params=id3) def test_trove_database_create(self): id3 = self.check_machine_status() id3 = str(id3) self.trove('database-create', params=id3 + ' testDB') def test_trove_instance_delete(self): id3 = self.check_machine_status() id3 = str(id3) self.trove('delete', params=id3)

Use assigned_networks list in node.admin_interface

Tests added.

Change-Id: Ic554b7e225f30a273426dc97473f754a98512778

subject: Base Implementation of KVS Dogpile Refactor
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-29 06:36:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/16f26d8f5642bfe1586f5159353e4cc0830cb144', 'message': "Base Implementation of KVS Dogpile Refactor

This changeset implements a KVS interface that makes use of
dogpile's backends.  Included is an in-memory database (primarily
to be used for testing) that isolates data from modification via
liberal use of copy.deepcopy.  The memcached backend is a manager
pivot to allow the use of the various dogpile.cache memcache
backends while maintaining a simplified interface.

The KVS system implements a Distributed-Capable locking system that
hooks into the dogpile.cache backend mutexes.  A global toggle has
been added to enable/disable locking across all KVS backends.

The scafolding for the use of the keystoneclient implemented
memcache_crypt has also been applied across the top-level KVS
interface.  The memcache_crypt is completely optional, and will
not impact any aspect of the operation unless the KVSBase
instantiation is explicitly configured to use it.

The original kvs implementation has been moved to
keystone.common.kvs.legacy.  For compatibility all elements of the
old keystone.common.kvs namespace have been made available at
keystone.common.kvs.  The legacy kvs implementation has been marked
for deprecation after the release of ICEHOUSE.

bp: dogpile-kvs-backends
Change-Id: I8af1adfcb181f9118a1f21aada2e000c6cc0c201

commit_message:
Base Implementation of KVS Dogpile Refactor

This changeset implements a KVS interface that makes use of
dogpile's backends.  Included is an in-memory database (primarily
to be used for testing) that isolates data from modification via
liberal use of copy.deepcopy.  The memcached backend is a manager
pivot to allow the use of the various dogpile.cache memcache
backends while maintaining a simplified interface.

The KVS system implements a Distributed-Capable locking system that
hooks into the dogpile.cache backend mutexes. Locking can be
toggled at configuration time for a given KeyValueStore
instantiation.

The original kvs implementation has been moved to
keystone.common.kvs.legacy.  For compatibility all elements of the
old keystone.common.kvs namespace have been made available at
keystone.common.kvs.  The legacy kvs implementation has been marked
for deprecation after the release of ICEHOUSE.

DocImpact

bp: dogpile-kvs-backends
Change-Id: I8af1adfcb181f9118a1f21aada2e000c6cc0c201
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/26/59126/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright 2013 Metacloud, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Keystone In-Memory Dogpile.cache backend implementation. """ import copy from dogpile.cache import api NO_VALUE = api.NO_VALUE class MemoryBackend(api.CacheBackend): """A backend that uses a plain dictionary. There is no size management, and values which are placed into the dictionary will remain until explicitly removed. Note that Dogpile's expiration of items is based on timestamps and does not remove them from the cache. E.g.:: from dogpile.cache import make_region region = make_region().configure( 'keystone.common.kvs.Memory' ) To disable isolation of the in-memory db it can be passed with the ``isolation`` argument. This will cause all get/set operations with the backend to not perform a copy.deepcopy on each element before saving/retrieving the value to ensure that no changes occur in the backing db due to subsequent code changing the returned reference:: region = make_region().configure( 'keystone.common.kvs.Memory', arguments={ 'isolation':False } ) """ def __init__(self, arguments): self._db = {} self.isolation = arguments.pop('isolation', False) def _isolate_value(self, value): if not self.isolation and value is not NO_VALUE: value = copy.deepcopy(value) return value def get(self, key): return self._isolate_value(self._db.get(key, NO_VALUE)) def get_multi(self, keys): return [self.get(key) for key in keys] def set(self, key, value): self._db[key] = self._isolate_value(value) def set_multi(self, mapping): for key, value in mapping.items(): self.set(key, value) def delete(self, key): self._db.pop(key, None) def delete_multi(self, keys): for key in keys: self.delete(key)

commit_message:
Add validation for an existence of a resource type

Validation of resource type existence was missing.
The patch adds validation checks that in the template the resource
type is set and is not an empty string.

Change-Id: I171644010ec868e8acc4c29556889256e8bf51b6
Closes-Bug: #1257243

commit_message:
XenAPI: Synchronize on all VBD plug/unplug per VM

Dynamically adding or removing a device needs to be synchronized
to work around a bug in XenServer 6.1 and 6.2 where simultaneous
events can be partially ignored, leading to a failure to plug or
unplug.  The bug is between two internal components in XenServer
which pass messages - the first component will ignore all messages
from the second while a plug/unplug is in progress, expecting
only one message to be received.  If two plug/unplugs occur in
this time, an internal assertion is raised as XAPIs internal state
is inconsistent.

Change I7b86325714e38b00a2f51bbf083b5532a6c51fa9 attempted to
work around the issue by retrying - however that does not catch
all failures.  This change should eliminate some of the known
INTERNAL_ERROR failures, but not all, so I7b8 need not be
reverted.

Change Ie7a64c481a9e3874df9d5924fbb050ac7ab117db does the same
as this, but only for VBD.plug.

Change-Id: If78d4e5f1dd84f1d4a588f25b8f887a7b125bbea
Closes-bug: 1217972

commit_message:
Fix the upper values of test_network_quotas

In test_network_quotas scenario test, hard-coded values are used as
upper value.
These should be the actual quota values.

Change-Id: Ief1b12e13d0a191f2db78540d249c72c0dcc7d19
Closes-Bug: #1252999

commit_message:
Change retry to attempt for retry filter logic

After patch of Ia355810b106fee14a55f48081301a310979befac, retry
filter was renamed to IgnoreAttemptedHostsFilter and its variable
retry was changed to attempt, so it is better to update nova scheduler
and nova compute logic by replace retry to attempt.

This can make sure once nova using filters from oslo, there is no need
to change retry logic.

Change-Id: I801c89352e451f6ce45531fd1a358f41b848d20e
Closes-Bug: #1260588

commit_message:
Adding an option to use qpid instead of rabbit or zeromq

Patch 1/2 rabbit and zeromq doesn't work very well on
power, and there's no option to pass to Jenkins to use
qpid (which works fine on power)

Change-Id: Iaf2dc45130e525bf3e2e23395e5e7c8c9fa29e1b

commit_message:
UUID vs PKI docs

Change-Id: I698516e212e3a1f470a8131aca207e96925b3a40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/76/57276/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PKI or UUID? ^^^^^^^^^^^^ UUID-based tokens are randomly generated opaque strings that are issued and validated by the identity service. They must be persisted by the identity service in order to be later validated, and revoking them is simply a matter of deleting them from the token persistence backend. PKI-based tokens are Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) strings that can be verified offline using keystone's public signing key. The only reason for them to be persisted by the identity service is to later build token revocation lists (explicit lists of tokens that have been revoked), otherwise they are theoretically ephemeral. PKI tokens should therefore have much better scaling characteristics (decentralized validation). They are base-64 encoded (and are therefore not URL-friendly without encoding) and may be too long to fit in either headers or URLs if they contain extensive service catalogs or other additional attributes. Both UUID- and PKI-based tokens are bearer tokens, meaning that they must be protected from unnecessary disclosure to prevent unauthorized access. The current architectural approaches for both UUID- and PKI-based tokens have pain points exposed by environments under heavy load (search bugs and blueprints for the latest details and potential solutions), although PKI tokens became the default configuration option in the Grizzly release.

commit_message:
Replace startswith by more precise store matching

Currently a source is considered valid if it only starts with a specific set
of word. For example swift is a valid location scheme, so is swiftpe or
swiftopenstack with the current implementation. This commit compare the scheme
of the location - all of it - to a given set of supported schemes

Change-Id: Ie827c3c3f36fbf958a1270039cab28d4c5fc4fe1
Closes-Bug: #1257496

commit_message:
Fix issues handling trust tokens via ec2tokens API

Trust scoped tokens are handled incorectly when making requests
via the ec2tokens API, meaning that the restrictions enforced
by trust-scoped tokens are not respected when obtaining a token
via ec2token signature validation.

Storing the trust_id in the blob associated with the ec2 keypair,
and passing that id in the metadata when requesting a v2 token
solves the issue.

Change-Id: I52566384d7813ef0e2f20fb94a5076386457ff02
Closes-Bug: #1242597

commit_message:
Add oslo.rootwrap to global requirements

Per-project rootwraps (cinder-rootwrap, nova-rootwrap, neutron-rootwrap)
are being replaced by the common oslo-rootwrap (oslo.rootwrap package).

As a first step in the migration, oslo.rootwrap needs to get installed
as a runtime dependency.

Change-Id: I90d5ca8504855edac8a09492203100ba7f708d80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/38/61738/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Provide guest_info per datastore

Reason:
- Trove configs holding more then one options for different datastores,
best way to simplify main config is to externalize config per datastore,
which would handle datastore specific parameters
Changes:
- Changing scripts for guest launch
- Adding stack post-install hooks
  (copying trove-guestagent.conf.sample into /etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf)

Change-Id: I87d3c1bf27e71fa5297b77204bbe1cd996c9d517
Implements: blueprint template-config-per-datastore

commit_message:
Fix bug with no test status updating while standalone run.

Sometimes when single test from testrun is started or restarted its
status is not updated by nose storage plugin. In those conditions
session from nose storage plugin can not access data that were provided
by session of higher level in models.py logic of parent process.
Explicitly closing parent process session before start test running
does help but some additional code modification required in
this case.

Change-Id: Ie5415963c189b66cca58986370982f814f2a7431

commit_message:
Test db2 disconnect with real db2 dialect

It will be a more usefull test to use the real db2
dialect.is_disconnect function logic to make sure
there is not regresssions in that area. Will need
ibm_db_sa to be included in test framework first.

Depends on change I7f91ab1978399f6dcabc76c939be54746db14620

Change-Id: I220d240809bb8dc0b3b5fef9fe4827d9fc50fe10

commit_message:
Python3: Use six.StringIO for io.Bytes()

The newer version of six (1.4.1) provides six.StringIO which
is a fake file object for textual data. It's an alias for StringIO.StringIO
in python2 and io.StringIO in Python3.

Use the fake object where approiate.

Change-Id: Ie4b812024336dbbcef5aa5446c2a5751dd90f7e8
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/91/51891/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add a really basic in-memory jobboard

Change-Id: I6a28c5fa812b3aef28448a0143db3ba8119eade9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/51/60151/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright (C) 2013 Yahoo! Inc. All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import threading from taskflow import states from taskflow import exceptions as excp from taskflow.jobs import jobboard from taskflow.job import job class MemoryJob(job.Job): def __init__(self, name, uuid, job_data, board): super(MemoryJob, self).__init__(name, uuid=uuid) self._board = board self._job_data = job_data @property def board(self): return self._board @property def owner(self): return self._job_data['owner'] @property def book(self): return self._job_data['book'] @property def state(self): return self._job_data['state'] class MemoryJobBoard(jobboard.JobBoard): def __init__(self, name): super(MemoryJobBoard, self).__init__(name) self._jobs = [] self._lock = threading.RLock() def __len__(self): return len(self._jobs) def post(self, job): with self._lock: # NOTE(harlowja): we intentionally share this dictionary with # the new job object returned and the internally held jobs in # this board so that we can mutate the attributes of returned # jobs when doing operations such as claim, abandon.... job_data = { 'owner': None, 'lock': threading.RLock(), 'book': job.book, 'state': states.UNCLAIMED, } new_job = MemoryJob(job.name, job.uuid, job_data, self) self._jobs.append((new_job, job_data)) return new_job def iterjobs(self, only_unclaimed=False): with self._lock: # Don't hold the lock while iterating (so make a copy of the list # that we will iterate over). jobs = list(self._jobs) for (job, job_data) in jobs: if only_unclaimed if job_data['owner'] is None: yield job else: yield job def _find_job(self, uuid): with self._lock: for (job, job_data) in self._jobs: if job.uuid == uuid: return (job, job_data) raise excp.JobNotFound("Unknown job %s requested" % (uuid)) def abandon(self, job, who): (matched_job, job_data) = self._find_job(job.uuid) with job_data['lock']: if job_data['owner'] != who or who is None: raise excp.InvalidJobOperation("Can not abandon a job %s" " which is owned by %s" % (job.uuid, job_data['owner'])) job_data['owner'] = None job_data['state'] = states.LOST def claim(self, job, who): (matched_job, job_data) = self._find_job(job.uuid) with job_data['lock']: if job_data['owner'] is not None: raise excp.UnclaimableJobException("Job %s already " "claimed by '%s'" % (job.uuid, job_data['owner'])) job_data['owner'] = who job_data['state'] = states.CLAIMED return jobboard.ClaimListener(matched_job, self, who) def consume(self, job, who): (matched_job, job_data) = self._find_job(job.uuid) with job_data['lock']: if job_data['owner'] != who or who is None: raise excp.InvalidJobOperation("Can not consume a job %s" " which is not owned by %s" % (job.uuid, job_data['owner'])) job_data['state'] = states.COMPLETE with self._lock: for i, (tmp_job, _job_data) in enumerate(self._jobs): if matched_job is tmp_job: self._jobs.pop(i) break

commit_message:
Use BaseTestCase from oslo Part 3

Replace base class for tests with BaseTestCase from
openstack/common/test.py

Add new base class for tests which need to set
property protections. Inherit StoreClearingUnitTest,
IsolatedUnitTest and UsingPolicyFileMixinTest
from it.

Oslo commit: 5d6d24c4e7d674b3f804e250983e835840b45039

Change-Id: Icf5d2a2ebefef72a6a37a5e0ae996f6d54b3eae4

subject: Avoid concurrent creation of the same network.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-02 21:12:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/00a00ed77490aea9339801af5a68465e16efb60c', 'message': "Avoid concurrent creation of the same network.

The DHCP agent will happily run multiple creation operations for a
network at the same time. Unfortunately they are not aware of each other
and can cause all sorts of issues. Deletion of a network while it is
also being created is a possibility as well.

This patch also includes some alterations of code that seems to often be
called after things have been deleted that are assumed to still be
around. This is causing a few unexpected exceptions and messing up
cleanup in several cases.

This commit message will need to be amended if it is an appropriate fix
because I really don't know how many bugs this will address at the
moment... except that is likely more than one.

Change-Id: I0dde9ddc5dcadde921b9db80439513fe6496fb45
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid concurrent creation of the same network.

The DHCP agent will happily run multiple creation operations for a
network at the same time. Unfortunately they are not aware of each other
and can cause all sorts of issues. Deletion of a network while it is
also being created is a possibility as well.

This patch also includes some alterations of code that seems to often be
called after things have been deleted that are assumed to still be
around. This is causing a few unexpected exceptions and messing up
cleanup in several cases.

This commit message will need to be amended if it is an appropriate fix
because I really don't know how many bugs this will address at the
moment... except that is likely more than one.

Change-Id: I0dde9ddc5dcadde921b9db80439513fe6496fb45

commit_message:
The default region name "regionOne" is different with most others

Modified the default region name in some places from "regionOne" to "RegionOne"

Fixes bug #1252992

Change-Id: I5b790032a48a7dde2b92eeab5d5a03536f155c79

commit_message:
"PrivateDnsName" returns physical resource name

Attributes "PrivateDnsName" and "PublicDnsName" return physical
resource name for resource AWS::EC2::Instance.

Change-Id: I21dea02241a56e02516c40d86e6b82a926226d74
Closes-Bug: #1245545

commit_message:
Replaces call to lvs with blockdev.

Replaces the call to lvs in virt/libvirt/utils.py:logical_volume_size()
with the more general blockdev.

Implements: blueprint encrypt-ephemeral-storage
Change-Id: I3e4e4e927a98fa9e396618e45ac01cc836a75988
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/48/57548/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # TODO(p-draigbrady) Possibly replace with the more general # use of blockdev --getsize64 in future out, _err = execute('lvs', '-o', 'lv_size', '--noheadings', '--units', 'b', '--nosuffix', path, run_as_root=True)

commit_message:
Add shutdown option to cleanup running periodic

Add a 'shutdown' option to the periodic task that cleans up instances
which are both deleted *and* running.

The option powers down instances and marks them as non-bootable.  This
is a flag for system administrators who would like to reclaim the
resources consumed by each instance, but leave the records around for
later examination/debugging.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint cleanup-running-deleted-shutdown

Change-Id: Id95845eb995b62ed8858fe61c6fdb34045721674

commit_message:
Enforce metadata string type on key/value pairs

The compute API is currently enforcing quota limits for user metadata
and length restrictions on the dict entries, but is not enforcing that
they are string types. This patch adds the checks for string type on the
keys and values in the metadata dict.

Closes-Bug: #1240319

Change-Id: Ic4aacc342cf37d929871287e6e4917f4f48b63e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/93/56793/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not isinstance(k, six.string_types): msg = _("Metadata property key '%s' is not a string.") % k raise exception.InvalidMetadata(reason=msg) if not isinstance(v, six.string_types): msg = (_("Metadata property value '%(v)s' for key '%(k)s' is " "not a string.") % {'v': v, 'k': k}) raise exception.InvalidMetadata(reason=msg)

Periodically flush expired tokens

Add a configuration option to enable automatic deletion of expired
tokens.

Implements: blueprint keystone-manage-token-flush-periodically

commit_message:
service: fix service alive checking

This change the way we check for service being alive in a more portable
way by using os.kill() with a null signal.

Change-Id: I588ab19de15b351c1de3ab28b8655e400b2a2064
