subject: Remove lock_dir on script failures
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-15 17:47:54.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift-recon-cron'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/d0b27f179600d46319cb7f137785d0608d50127f', 'message': 'Remove lock_dir on script failures

Under certain circunstances, if get_async_count or dump_cron_cache calls
fail, the lock_dir is not remved. All subsequent executions of
swift-recon-cron will fail with [Errno 17] file exists and will also die
until the lock_dir is manually removed.

- Move create/remove lock code into methods
- Wrap the get_async_count/dump_cron_cache calls wit bettwe exception
handling to ensure the lock_dir is always removed

Change-Id: I7bfe4c7871aa5fbc77078344dffe0e2a0bb2fc2e
Closes-Bug: #1251713
'}]
commit_message:
Remove lock_dir on script failures

Under certain circunstances, if get_async_count or dump_cron_cache calls
fail, the lock_dir is not remved. All subsequent executions of
swift-recon-cron will fail with [Errno 17] file exists and will also die
until the lock_dir is manually removed.

- Move create/remove lock code into methods
- Wrap the get_async_count/dump_cron_cache calls wit bettwe exception
handling to ensure the lock_dir is always removed

Change-Id: I7bfe4c7871aa5fbc77078344dffe0e2a0bb2fc2e
Closes-Bug: #1251713
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/70/56670/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_lock(lock_dir, logger): try: os.mkdir(lock_dir) except OSError as e: logger.critical(str(e)) print str(e) sys.exit(1) def remove_lock(lock_dir, logger): try: os.rmdir(lock_dir) except Exception: logger.exception(_('Exception remove cronjob lock')) create_lock(lock_dir, logger) except Exception as e: remove_lock(lock_dir, logger) print str(e) sys.exit(1) dump_recon_cache({'async_pending': asyncs}, cache_file, logger) except Exception as e: logger.exception( _('Exception during recon-cron while dumping cache')) print str(e) sys.exit(1) finally: remove_lock(lock_dir, logger)
deleted_lines: try: os.mkdir(lock_dir) except OSError as e: logger.critical(str(e)) print str(e) sys.exit(1) except Exception: dump_recon_cache({'async_pending': asyncs}, cache_file, logger) os.rmdir(lock_dir) except Exception: logger.exception(_('Exception remove cronjob lock'))

commit_message:
Allow time for keystone restart after db_sync

Allow time for keystone service to restart after a keystone-manage
db_sync run to ensure that subsequent keystone queries do not get
connection refused errors.

Partial-Bug: #1255149
Change-Id: I5d57010736536495bf2e5cc0d094f2f602770ab1

commit_message:
Add vertica driver

Change-Id: I26272c70012871a75822bcfdc2e2f787221eee6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/69/59569/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from ceilometer.openstack.common import log from ceilometer.storage import base import datetime import os from oslo.config import cfg import pyodbc from pyvertica.batch import VerticaBatch LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) VERTICA_OPTS = [ cfg.IntOpt('event_batch_size', default=100000, help='Number of events to batch'), cfg.IntOpt('trait_batch_size', default=2000000, help='Number of traits to batch') ] cfg.CONF.register_opts(VERTICA_OPTS, group='vertica') class BatchedList(object): def __init__(self, commit_size, batch_args): self.commit_size = commit_size self.batch_args = batch_args self.current_batch = [] def extend(self, rows): self.current_batch.extend(rows) self._check_size() def append(self, row): self.current_batch.append(row) self._check_size() def _check_size(self): if len(self.current_batch) >= self.commit_size: self._commit() def _commit(self): batch = VerticaBatch(**self.batch_args) map(lambda x: batch.insert_list(x), self.current_batch) batch.commit() self.current_batch = [] class VerticaStorage(base.StorageEngine): """Insert data into vertica """ def get_connection(self, conf): """Return a Connection instance based on the configuration settings. """ return Connection(conf) class Connection(base.Connection): """Base class for storage system connections. """ def __init__(self, conf): self.conf = conf self.dsn = conf.database.connection.split('://')[1] LOG.debug("Loading Vertica driver, dsn=%s" % self.dsn) self._setup_batches() def _setup_batches(self): self._setup_event_batch() self._setup_trait_batch() def _setup_trait_batch(self): conn = pyodbc.connect('DSN=%s' % self.dsn, ansi=True) self.trait_batch = VerticaBatch('ceilometer.traits', connection=conn, reconnect=False, column_list=['event_id', 'trait_name', 'trait_type', 't_string', 't_int', 't_float', 't_datetime']) def _setup_event_batch(self): conn = pyodbc.connect('DSN=%s' % self.dsn, ansi=True) self.event_batch = VerticaBatch('ceilometer.events', connection=conn, reconnect=False, column_list=['event_id', 'event_type', 'generated']) def upgrade(self): pass def clear(self): pass def record_metering_data(self, data): """Write the data to the backend storage system. :param data: a dictionary such as returned by # ceilometer.meter.meter_message_from_counter """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.') def clear_expired_metering_data(self, ttl): """Clear expired data from the backend storage system according to the time-to-live. :param ttl: Number of seconds to keep records for. """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.') def get_users(self, source=None): """Return an iterable of user id strings. :param source: Optional source filter. """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.') def get_projects(self, source=None): """Return an iterable of project id strings. :param source: Optional source filter. """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.') def get_resources(self, user=None, project=None, source=None, start_timestamp=None, start_timestamp_op=None, end_timestamp=None, end_timestamp_op=None, metaquery={}, resource=None, pagination=None): """Return an iterable of dictionaries containing resource information. { 'resource_id': UUID of the resource, 'project_id': UUID of project owning the resource, 'user_id': UUID of user owning the resource, 'timestamp': UTC datetime of last update to the resource, 'metadata': most current metadata for the resource, 'meter': list of the meters reporting data for the resource, } :param user: Optional ID for user that owns the resource. :param project: Optional ID for project that owns the resource. :param source: Optional source filter. :param start_timestamp: Optional modified timestamp start range. :param start_timestamp_op: Optional start time operator, like gt, ge. :param end_timestamp: Optional modified timestamp end range. :param end_timestamp_op: Optional end time operator, like lt, le. :param metaquery: Optional dict with metadata to match on. :param resource: Optional resource filter. :param pagination: Optional pagination query. """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.') def get_meters(self, user=None, project=None, resource=None, source=None, limit=None, metaquery={}, pagination=None): """Return an iterable of dictionaries containing meter information. { 'name': name of the meter, 'type': type of the meter (guage, counter), 'resource_id': UUID of the resource, 'project_id': UUID of project owning the resource, 'user_id': UUID of user owning the resource, } :param user: Optional ID for user that owns the resource. :param project: Optional ID for project that owns the resource. :param resource: Optional resource filter. :param source: Optional source filter. :param limit: Maximum number of results to return. :param metaquery: Optional dict with metadata to match on. :param pagination: Optional pagination query. """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.') def get_samples(self, sample_filter): """Return an iterable of samples as created by :func:`ceilometer.meter.meter_message_from_counter`. """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.') def get_meter_statistics(self, sample_filter, period=None, groupby=None): """Return a dictionary containing meter statistics. described by the query parameters. The filter must have a meter value set. { 'min': 'max': 'avg': 'sum': 'count': 'period': 'period_start': 'period_end': 'duration': 'duration_start': 'duration_end': } """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.') def get_alarms(self, name=None, user=None, project=None, enabled=None, alarm_id=None, pagination=None): """Yields a lists of alarms that match filters """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.') def create_alarm(self, alarm): """Create alarm. """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.') def update_alarm(self, alarm): """update alarm """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.') def delete_alarm(self, alarm_id): """Delete a alarm """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.') def get_alarm_changes(self, alarm_id, on_behalf_of, user=None, project=None, type=None, start_timestamp=None, start_timestamp_op=None, end_timestamp=None, end_timestamp_op=None): """Yields list of AlarmChanges describing alarm history Changes are always sorted in reverse order of occurence, given the importance of currency. Segregation for non-administrative users is done on the basis of the on_behalf_of parameter. This allows such users to have visibility on both the changes initiated by themselves directly (generally creation, rule changes, or deletion) and also on those changes initiated on their behalf by the alarming service (state transitions after alarm thresholds are crossed). :param alarm_id: ID of alarm to return changes for :param on_behalf_of: ID of tenant to scope changes query (None for administrative user, indicating all projects) :param user: Optional ID of user to return changes for :param project: Optional ID of project to return changes for :project type: Optional change type :param start_timestamp: Optional modified timestamp start range :param start_timestamp_op: Optional timestamp start range operation :param end_timestamp: Optional modified timestamp end range :param end_timestamp_op: Optional timestamp end range operation """ raise NotImplementedError('Alarm history not implemented') def record_alarm_change(self, alarm_change): """Record alarm change event. """ raise NotImplementedError('Alarm history not implemented') def _vals_to_utf8(self, vals): return [ val.encode('utf-8') if not isinstance(val, datetime.datetime) else val.str().encode('utf-8') for val in vals ] def _list_to_db_string(self, value_list): enclosed_by = '"' escaped_enclosed_by = '\\%s' % enclosed_by return ";".join([ '%s%s%s' % (enclosed_by, unicode(value).replace(enclosed_by, escaped_enclosed_by), enclosed_by) if value is not None else '' for value in value_list]) + "\n" def _commit_batch(self, batch): # Todo(herndon) - handle batch erors error_bool, error_file_obj = batch.get_errors() if error_bool: print "batch errors: %s" % error_file_obj.read() LOG.error("batch errors: %s" % (error_file_obj.read())) batch.commit() def _commit_event_batch(self): self._commit_batch(self.event_batch) def _commit_trait_batch(self): self._commit_batch(self.trait_batch) def add_trait(self, id, t): trait = [id, t.name, t.dtype] for type in xrange(1,5): trait.append(str(t.value) if type == t.dtype else None) self.trait_batch.insert_list(trait) if self.trait_batch.get_batch_count() >= self.conf.vertica.trait_batch_size: self._commit_trait_batch() def add_event(self, event): event_row = [event.message_id, event.event_type, str(event.generated)] self.event_batch.insert_list(event_row) if self.event_batch.get_batch_count() >= self.conf.vertica.event_batch_size: self._commit_event_batch() def record_events(self, events): """Write the events. :param events: a list of model.Event objects. """ try: for event in events: self.add_event(event) for t in event.traits: self.add_trait(event.message_id, t) except Exception, ex: LOG.error("Error recording event: %s" % str(ex)) raise ex def get_events(self, event_filter): """Return an iterable of model.Event objects. :param event_filter: EventFilter instance """ raise NotImplementedError('Events not implemented.')

Refactor glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py

Remove code duplication from module, improve set-ups

Partially implements blueprint glance-tests-code-duplication

commit_message:
Allow short names for volume_driver in cinder.conf

This allows configuring the volume driver like:
volume_driver="nfs"
instead of
volume_driver="cinder.volume.drivers.nfs.NfsDriver"

The setting is also treated as case-insensitive to allow "LVM" or
"lvm", etc.

Driver identifiers not listed in the translation table will be
treated as class paths, as before.

Change-Id: I9e28e2afb07c88353a546a87e76a3220b051c9f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/46/22246/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SHORT_NAME_MAPPING = { # Easy names for volume_driver= in cinder.conf. # Stick to [a-z][0-9]_, avoid "driver" 'coraid': 'cinder.volume.drivers.coraid.CoraidDriver', 'glusterfs': 'cinder.volume.drivers.glusterfs.GlusterfsDriver', 'lvm': 'cinder.volume.drivers.lvm.LVMISCSIDriver', 'netapp_nfs': 'cinder.volume.drivers.netapp.nfs.NetAppNFSDriver', 'nexenta': 'cinder.volume.drivers.nexenta.volume.NexentaDriver', 'nfs': 'cinder.volume.drivers.nfs.NfsDriver', 'rbd': 'cinder.volume.drivers.rbd.RBDDriver', 'sheepdog': 'cinder.volume.drivers.sheepdog.SheepdogDriver', 'solaris_iscsi': 'cinder.volume.drivers.san.solaris.SolarisISCSIDriver', 'solidfire': 'cinder.volume.drivers.solidfire.SolidFire', 'windows': 'cinder.volume.drivers.windows.WindowsDriver', 'xiv': 'cinder.volume.drivers.xiv.XIVDriver', 'zadara': 'cinder.volume.drivers.zadara.ZadaraVPSAISCSIDriver' } lowercase_volume_driver = volume_driver.lower() if lowercase_volume_driver in SHORT_NAME_MAPPING: short_name = SHORT_NAME_MAPPING[lowercase_volume_driver] LOG.debug(_("Translated volume driver %(volume_driver)s " "to %(short_name)s") % locals()) volume_driver = short_name

subject: Stale kvm processes when using libguestfs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-03 22:14:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/disk/vfs/guestfs.py', 'nova/virt/disk/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e94c9e60478db2945b4ce40f02b189a33bd8bdcb', 'message': 'Stale kvm processes when using libguestfs

When setting up images for nova there is insufficient error handling
when using libguestfs which leaves stale kvm processes on the compute
node.  These stale processes consume CPU and memory and can starve a
compute node of resources.  The stale processes are not reaped when the
instance that triggered the libguestfs injection is deleted.

Change-Id: I96ed4fc6871af0134c69fc3b2d39a750a5e5d0f2
Partial-Bug: #1246852
'}]
commit_message:
Stale kvm processes when using libguestfs

When setting up images for nova there is insufficient error handling
when using libguestfs which leaves stale kvm processes on the compute
node.  These stale processes consume CPU and memory and can starve a
compute node of resources.  The stale processes are not reaped when the
instance that triggered the libguestfs injection is deleted.

Change-Id: I96ed4fc6871af0134c69fc3b2d39a750a5e5d0f2
Partial-Bug: #1246852
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/54/59854/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: try: fs = vfs.VFS.instance_for_image(image, 'qcow2', None) fs.teardown() try: return inject_data_into_fs(fs, key, net, metadata, admin_password, files, mandatory) finally: fs.teardown()

commit_message:
Sync Log Levels from OSLO

The iso8601 debug messages were spamming neutron-server's logs.

cbfded9c Default iso8601 logging to WARN

Change-Id: I526813fd4b29e23977c459c70ac63d87bd33b849
Closes-Bug: 1257396

commit_message:
OpenStack Identity API v3 OS-SHARED-SECRET Extension

Provide the ability for identity users to request a token using a shared
secret authorization method. This extension requires v3.0+ of the
Identity API.
The user provides a credential_id to identify the credential type and the
corresponding shared-secret information as secret.

blueprint access-key-authentication

Change-Id: Ibfbef444395e9eaa773a56839f38fa1697ebac64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack-attic/identity-api refs/changes/71/46771/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenStack Identity API v3 OS-ACCESS-KEY Extension ================================================= Provide the ability for identity users to request a token using an access-key authorization method. This extension requires v3.0+ of the Identity API. The user provides an identification method using an access key and the corresponding secret information as a secret-key. Definitions ----------- - *User:* An Identity API service user and the entity that authorizes the creation of an Access Tokens. - *Access Token:* A token used to request new Identity API tokens tokens on behalf of the authorizing User, instead of using the User’s credentials. - *Access Key:* A key used by the User to identify itself. - *Secret Key:* A secret used by the User to establish ownership of the Request. Authentication Flow ------------------- Authentication via Access Key is done in two steps: 1. An Identity API service User requests an Identity API token passing access-key and secret-key. 2. The Identity API service validates the User request, decypher the secret-key stored in the service's keys store and compares it with the secret-key provided in the request. API Resources ------------- ### Request an Identity API Token: `POST /auth/tokens` The Consumer can now request valid Identity API service tokens representing the authorizing User's delegated authorization and identity (impersonation). The generated token's roles and scope will match that which the Consumer initially requested. Request Parameters: To authenticate with the OS-ACCESS-KEY extension, `access-key` must be specified as an authentication method. Example request: { "auth": { "identity": { "methods": [ "access-key" ], "access-key": { "access":"VCAVE3Y6RL9K8ADVKMY5", "secret":"quyNVz7gMtpG9QsLz0DUrqGocYbr5X+KGbkJsqzs" } } } } The returned token is scoped to the requested project and with the User's roles. Example OpenStack token response: [Various OpenStack token responses](https://github.com/openstack/identity-api/blob/master/openstack-identity-api/v3/src/markdown/identity-api-v3.md#authentication-responses)

commit_message:
Adding extra specs to flavor show and detail call

Adding a new extension in v3 which will add 'extra_specs'
to the flavor show and detail call. This will include the
extra_specs, along with the other information
related to the flavor.

Implements blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list

Change-Id: I432846ebbb0b7a0f06dc48abf9337084d75f1d3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/19/61319/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Clean-up files use

- file_hack was a hack used in Essex and now outdated.
- nothing is using nova-novncproxy.init

This patch aims to delete files/* and file_hack.pp which is now
useless.

Change-Id: I94b40e34fd61d778c7450d149f49e28612c58d31
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Add metering agent support

The Ceilometer project is able to get meters from Neutron via the
notifications system on how much bandwidth the projects are using.
The idea is to meter this as the L3 routers levels.

The feature exists since Havana.

Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
implement blueprint metering-agent

Change-Id: I62ad9b7455e5f2bc3455b55a346f2515ca1040a3
(cherry picked from commit bf34f8631cfae0550dbe082740668df82f0cdfd4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/56/60656/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Copyright (C) 2013 eNovance SAS <licensing@enovance.com> # # Author: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # Unit tests for neutron::plugins::metering class # require 'spec_helper' describe 'neutron::agents::metering' do let :pre_condition do "class { 'neutron': rabbit_password => 'passw0rd', service_plugins => ['neutron.services.metering.metering_plugin.MeteringPlugin'] }" end let :params do {} end let :default_params do { :package_ensure => 'present', :enabled => true, :debug => false, :interface_driver => 'neutron.agent.linux.interface.OVSInterfaceDriver', :use_namespaces => true, :measure_interval => '30', :report_interval => '300' } end shared_examples_for 'neutron metering agent' do let :p do default_params.merge(params) end it { should include_class('neutron::params') } it 'configures metering_agent.ini' do should contain_neutron_metering_agent_config('DEFAULT/debug').with_value(p[:debug]); should contain_neutron_metering_agent_config('DEFAULT/interface_driver').with_value(p[:interface_driver]); should contain_neutron_metering_agent_config('DEFAULT/use_namespaces').with_value(p[:use_namespaces]); should contain_neutron_metering_agent_config('DEFAULT/measure_interval').with_value(p[:measure_interval]); should contain_neutron_metering_agent_config('DEFAULT/report_interval').with_value(p[:report_interval]); end it 'installs neutron metering agent package' do if platform_params.has_key?(:metering_agent_package) should contain_package('neutron-metering-agent').with( :name => platform_params[:metering_agent_package], :ensure => p[:package_ensure] ) should contain_package('neutron').with_before(/Package\[neutron-metering-agent\]/) should contain_package('neutron-metering-agent').with_before(/Neutron_metering_agent_config\[.+\]/) should contain_package('neutron-metering-agent').with_before(/Neutron_config\[.+\]/) else should contain_package('neutron').with_before(/Neutron_metering_agent_config\[.+\]/) end end it 'configures neutron metering agent service' do should contain_service('neutron-metering-service').with( :name => platform_params[:metering_agent_service], :enable => true, :ensure => 'running', :require => 'Class[Neutron]' ) end end context 'on Debian platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'Debian' } end let :platform_params do { :metering_agent_package => 'neutron-metering-agent', :metering_agent_service => 'neutron-metering-agent' } end it_configures 'neutron metering agent' end context 'on RedHat platforms' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'RedHat' } end let :platform_params do { :metering_agent_service => 'neutron-metering-agent' } end it_configures 'neutron metering agent' end end

commit_message:
TTL mechanism support with expirer service

Aims to support a TTL mechanism for data entering Ceilometer
collector database.
TTL is very useful to configure when getting a lot of meters.

implement blueprint ttl-support
Change-Id: I9d98e8b833ad94fd79722dee7226e7f4f03aaa2e
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

added_lines: # # Copyright (C) 2013 eNovance SAS <licensing@enovance.com> # # Author: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == Class: ceilometer::expirer # # Setups Ceilometer Expirer service to enable TTL feature. # # === Parameters # # [*time_to_live*] # (optional) Number of seconds that samples are kept in the database. # Should be a valid integer # Defaults to '-1' to disable TTL and keep forever the datas. # # [*minute*] # (optional) Defaults to '1'. # # [*hour*] # (optional) Defaults to '0'. # # [*monthday*] # (optional) Defaults to '*'. # # [*month*] # (optional) Defaults to '*'. # # [*weekday*] # (optional) Defaults to '*'. # class ceilometer::expirer ( $time_to_live = '-1', $minute = 1, $hour = 0, $monthday = '*', $month = '*', $weekday = '*', ) inherits ceilometer { include ceilometer::params ceilometer_config { 'database/time_to_live': value => $time_to_live; } cron { 'ceilometer-expirer': command => $ceilometer::params::expirer_command, environment => 'PATH=/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/sbin', user => 'ceilometer', minute => $minute, hour => $hour, monthday => $monthday, month => $month, weekday => $weekday } }

commit_message:
Sync minor updates in oslo.db module

* vim headers removed
* py3kcompat/urlutils functions used instead of urlparse
* log.warning() used instead of log.warn()
* license, typos and docstrings fixed
* locking fixed

Change-Id: I2a9bfc04ae473220da39cdf723247deba87dc07b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/41/60941/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functoolsimport subprocess import lockfilefrom savanna.openstack.common.gettextutils import _from savanna.openstack.common.py3kcompat import urlutilsdef _set_db_lock(lock_path=None, lock_prefix=None): def decorator(f): @functools.wraps(f) def wrapper(*args, **kwargs): try: path = lock_path or os.environ.get("SAVANNA_LOCK_PATH") lock = lockfile.FileLock(os.path.join(path, lock_prefix)) with lock: LOG.debug(_('Got lock "%s"') % f.__name__) return f(*args, **kwargs) finally: LOG.debug(_('Lock released "%s"') % f.__name__) return wrapper return decorator process = subprocess.Popen(cmd, shell=True, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT) output = process.communicate()[0] self.assertEqual(0, process.returncode, @_set_db_lock(lock_prefix='migration_tests-') conn_pieces = urlutils.urlparse(conn_string)
deleted_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 import commandsimport urlparse from savanna.openstack.common import lockutils status, output = commands.getstatusoutput(cmd) self.assertEqual(0, status, @lockutils.synchronized('pgadmin', 'tests-', external=True) conn_pieces = urlparse.urlparse(conn_string)
